24535090.review: I want to like this game, I really do, but there are some GLARING issues. The game starts out awesome and amazingly fun, but you soon find out that as you progress the levels become insanely hard to the point of ridiculousnous. I'm all for a challenge, but this gets into tare your hair out frustrating (get to the mission "Brain Dead" and you'll see what I mean). There's some coding issues, especially with collision. Sometimes the zombies clip, and as some other users have pointed out, when that happens it can literally lose you the level requiring a restart of the entire thing. that'd be fine, except often when this happens it's after you've already spend 10 to 15 minutes getting to that point and now have to redo everything. Also, there's some game killers, on the aformentioned Brain Dead mission (which is a boss level) sometimes when you hit him with the cannon, he zaps the gun late and this makes him invincible. I've restarted that level about 30 times now because of that bug. I just can't recommend this game, if the devs would have balanced the fun better with the challenge it would have been great, unfortunately often times it makes you just want to jump off the same cliff the zombies are in frustration.

24513186.review:
Overview: a classical game "Lemmings" (and some gerne from other classics) have been converted into a new zombie world.  Worth trying.

Game system: a plain zombie just keep walking in one direction until they go into walls, doors, or humans.  You have to control those brainless walkers with environments and special zombies with some abilities, which you can order them to evolve with some costs.

Cons: Though this game is fun and playable enough, there are some improvements required. 1) Its GUI is too simple and small with a mouse and a keyboard, and descriptions are too short for players to understand the rules of the game.  2) There seems to be an error that timers goes on when you pause the game, in stages with Time Attack Challenges.  This can be the specification, and if this is true, there can be some description on it.  3) There seems to be only one right solution to beat Challenges.  More alternative solutions can make the game more enjoyable.

24511836.review:
[b]TL;DR[/b]: If you're okay with the price tag, it's a great game. If you're not, it's still a great game.

[i][b]Zombie Night Terror[/b][/i] is a fresh take on the zombie genre. I love zombie games, but picking through the veritable horde of zombie slop will leave you dizzy and crying from lack of worthy contenders. So, when something like this comes along that tries to escape the cookie cutter zombie survival formula, I perk up.

The comparison to [i]Lemmings[/i] is apt, as in both games you are tasked with herding a group of mindless fools towards the other end of the map. [i]Zombie Night Terror[/i] diverges, however, in how it approaches this, and the end result is two very different experiences.

You start out with a base zombie type but are soon treated to a host of different mutations that you get to apply at your discretion. You can pause and unpause the game and issue a series of commands, or play completely without it for an extra challenge.

The world and story is rife with references to various movies, including [i]Night of the Living Dead, Return of the Living Dead, Terminator[/i], and so on.

Without spoiling too much, the story involves an experimental drug, called Romero (eh, eh?), and the whole apocalypse is basically one enormous drug trial run horribly amok.

The missions vary greatly in both length and complexity. But whether there are enough missions to justify the price point is entirely up to you—your mileage may vary.

The game is fun (no doubt about it), but you will run into a few irritating frustrations. At times, the game explains perfectly well what you need to know, and at other times you don't have nearly enough information. I may just be an idiot, but it would have been nice to have a few more hints.

More importantly, the game leaves very little room for failure. You can easily end up in a state where you've killed every single human on the map, but because you lack a zombie in one specific location, you simply cannot finish the level. It is [i]incredibly[/i] aggravating.

Beyond that and a few minor bugs, I didn't run into any major problems.

PS. Did you know zombies can fly?

24509555.review:
This is essentially Lemmings with zombies. A rather unique take on the concept that was executed to damn near perfection. Aside from a lone release-day bug that sees jumping zombies being stuck on walls, the gameplay, the artstyle, the music, and the comedic pacing are all executed to near perfection, with almost every level having some gimmick or on-screen drama unfolding on the sidelines to keep things interesting for those who take the time to look around.

[b]I can only think of two things that could be added to improve this further:[/b]
1. A sandbox mode, because despite the lengthy campaign and its varied levels, the game does have an end. The levels (especially earlier on) limit you in terms of what powers you can use, while the latter ones are more focused on the challenge of applying what you've learned up to that point than goofing around with abilities. Choosing to just play for fun rather than compete with the obstacles that have been placed in your path could cost you your progress up to that point and force you to repeat the whole mission if you mess up. A sandbox mode with all powers unlocked and possibly randomized maps would do a lot for replayability without the pressure of time or losing being thrown into the mix.
2. Rewards for acheivements. As it stands, you get nothing for completing the optional challenges for each level other than a green marker next to the level title indicating that you've beaten it. It would be nice to get some form of payoff for the effort beyond just the sense of accomplishment. Custom zombie sprites for each chapter of the game maybe? Just a thought.

These are just wants though. As far as what the game promised, it totally delivered. Just know what you're getting: a zombie-themed puzzle game that's more about the challenge of micromanagement than it is simply going wild and throwing mindless legions of the undead at your problems until they go away.

24498161.review:
Saw the initial trailer for this one, and was intrigued by it. Glad it has finally come to fruition :) It's a Lemmings clone, with zombies, and a pizel art style. It's a lot of fun, though I do have a couple of downsides to note. First is that it is quite easy to get yourself in a position in a level in which you have live zombies, but cannot progress any further either due to not having enough zombies, or not enough points to spend to give them the right abilities. Restarting a level is easy - there is a button on the GUI to do this, so the dev's recognise this is a problem - but it is annoying all the same.

Secondly, and this is the bigger issue, is that the zombies do not stop moving. This means you need to think quickly a lot of the time, which means you feel rushed, not something I like in a game. Managing two groups of zombies on two separate parts of the screen when both of them are walking to their deaths is not a nice feeling! I would prefer if the zombies were stationery, until you moved them individually to where you wanted them, though the zombies always being in motion would have been designed into the game from the start (so would be very difficult to change now, mainly because of the potential level un-balancing that would occur).

PS: IMHO, guns in the hands of the humans in this game are a tad OP. One single person can mow down your entire zombie army by themselves, which sucks, as your zombies can't get close enough to try and stop them in many cases :( You can try jumping the zombies if you have the points and ability available for example, but humans can easily shoot them out of the air, which is frustrating. You can try to blow them up, again if you have the points and ability availability, but you have to be able to get close enough to do that - difficult when even a pistol seems to be a one shot kill on your zombies.

24488120.review:
If you have ever played Lemmings this game will be very familiar to you.  Each level is basically a puzzle where you have to complete the goal to go onto the next level.  The goal will be something like "get a zombie to the exit" or "kill X number of humans".  Each level also has a Challenge Goal like "kill ALL humans" or "destroy the Van" or "kill the drug lord".  These goals can be pretty tough because humans can be stuck away in seemingly inaccessible corners of the level.   The van can be filled with guys with crowbars that can smash zombie heads.  The drug lord can be surrounded by goons with shotguns.  The only controls you have are to mutate zombies into other forms and a switch on some doors to indicate if the zombies should break the door or not.  Like you could mutate a zombie into one that makes the others go a certain direction or throws them over a gap.

The story seems very loose so far.   I am about 8 levels in out of 40.  The tiny bits of story seem to be just to set up humorous situations.  It has the same feel as the movie Return of the Living Dead.  I just played a level that was straight out the teens having a party in the graveyard scene from RotLD complete with girl dancing naked on a grave. 

I only have a couple of minor negative things to say about the game so far.  One is that there is no checkpointing, so if you make a mistake 75% of the way through a level you need to start over from the beginning.  Once I set my guy to throw zombies over a gap and when it threw them they hit their heads on this beam and fell into the abyss.  Oops.   Another issue I have is when going for some challenges you have to be careful not to be too efficient in killing humans.  Because it seems they have it set that the level ends once all humans are dead.  So it doesn't work to kill all the humans and then go destroy the van, eg.

Pour résumer :

Zombie Night Terror = Lemmings avec la mode zombie du moment.

Pour détailler :

Un vrai plaisir ce jeu. Tu diriges les zombies et tu bouffes les humains !!

Les graphismes sombres en mode pixel géniaux...
La musique se prête parfaitement au jeu ...
Les dialogues entre humains sont géniaux et blindés d'humour ... 
Les dialogues valent vraiment le coup ... prendre le temps de les écouter ... 
Les niveaux ne sont pas fixes car des event sont programmés dans les niveaux ... du style une descente de flics contre des drogués te débloque un accès ...
Les humains ont tous les moyens pour te tuer ...
Et j'en passe ...


Le but est de donner des ordres aux zombies ... tu casses cette porte ... ce disjoncteur qui ouvrira un passage ... tu exploses pour créer un passage ... si tu utilises ce mutagène et que tu exploses la puissance sera décuplée ... tu peux transformer un nombre très très limité d'humains en zombies ... une 10aine de mutagènes te servent à remplir ta missions ...


Des mini-missions pour te former sur les mutagènes et les combos.
Des missions très compliqués ... de vrai casses têtes ...
Je m'étonnes même à recommencer plusieurs fois une mission pour la réussir et réaliser le défis ! (10 fois une mission pour un défis)
Il y a un défis pour chaque mission.

Ah important tu peux mettre pause ... tu peux accélérer le temps ... très pratique pour se repérer ou pour les non patients.


Les missions sont rapides ou pas. Sa dépend de vos objectifs à vous personnels.

Si tu aimes foncer dans le tas évite ce jeu ... 

Pour ma part plusieurs heures de jeu en perspective pour tout débloquer.

Je le conseil fortement ! Un vrai plaisir !!! Je l'ai eu à 11€ et je ne regrette pas.

Bon jeu à tous !

24470958.review:
When "Lemmings" was first released, a long time ago, I remember playing with a friend the whole night on my Amiga 500 ! 
It was a new kind of game, something never seen before... it became a classic.

Zombie Night Terror take the concept of "Lemmings" further and add more mechanics, more puzzle and, of course, ZOMBIES !!

Having finished the first chapter, I can tell that this game is fun and challenging. Like "Lemmings" in its time, the player must guide a horde of zombies to the end of the level or accomplish specific goals. Like the little rodents, zombies will walk straight, until the meet an obstacle (in wich case  they turn around). They won't stop for anything, not even a pit, and will fall to their... death...again... if you don't do something about it.
The player has lots of options at his disposal to guide his horde and each level explain how to use specific "ability".
You can create overlord that will act as a "brain" and give a specific direction to the zombies (later in the game you can use  more abilities on the overlord to overcome specific puzzles).
Other abilities include exploding, jumping, running, ...

I really like this game. It's challenging but not frustrating (except in some case). Some levels seem impossible, especially the first time you play them. But after learning how to solve puzzle (trial and error mostly), how the enemies react (some people have guns or weapons and will literally destroy your horde if you don't use your brain... uhuhu), you find a way to finish it. 

The pixel art is great, i love the music and the easter eggs to classic zombies movies are plenty !
If you like puzzle games like lemmings, zombies and black humor, get this game :)

What a fantastic little game.

The aim is simply to guide your zombies through multiple side-scrolling levels whilst completing objectives and bonus missions. The gameplay IS very similar to lemmings but it has many twists on the style and manages to set itself aside with a unique 'noir' atmosphere.

24454416.review:
2016's answer to Lemmings. 

Almost everything in the core design of Lemmings is here, except for the totally destructible environments. You're tasked with spreading the infection, devouring those who stand in your path. This will require cunning and strategy, as many of these survivors are armed with weapons that can do serious bodily damage to your precious zombie flock. You'll have to direct, transform and sacrifice your zomblings in order to effectively overwhelm the humans. 

You'll have a command bar at the bottom of the screen - this is where you can promote your zombies to higher tier roles, such as an overseer who can help change the tide of the zombies, or crawlers which are more highly attuned zombies that can scale walls and enter vents. All of these abilities are priced with a cost - so you can't just unleash hell from the get-go. More command points can be earned through sacrifice of your own zombies, or alternative means.

The game has beautiful pixel animation - bodies smack the floor with a satisfying splat, heads roll and bodies are ripped apart by zombie and weapons alike. It's a bit reminiscent of the fluidity you'd see from a Paul Robertson animation.

Pros:
Puzzle based design and plenty of variety in the challenges
Visuals are fun fun fun
Decent amount of levels (40)

Cons:
Lack of checkpoint or rewind action can make some levels frustrating as a single mistake can potential force you to redo the level.
The lack of color tires my eyes out after a while. I would have prefered to seen the game in color. It would have been glorious.

24448880.review:
As a kid I loved the game Lemmings. Zombie Night Terror is basically what you would get if you took Lemmings, added some zombies, and tweaked some mechanics to make a superior game.

If you liked Lemmings I would be really surprised if you don't enjoy Zombie Night Terror. In the game you become the leader of the zombie forces. Since zombies are stupid you pretty much have to tell them exactly what to do. This involves using DNA powers to give the zombies different orders. This works much better than it did in Lemmings.
What I really like about Zombie Night Terror is that you need to plan out your attack or you will fail. This isn't the type of game that you can just decide what you are going to do in the moment. Without a good plan your zombie horde will likely get destroyed by the humans. Each level plays like a puzzle where you need to figure out how to approach it in order to be successful. 

While I enjoyed the puzzle element of the game, Zombie Night Terror is not an easy game. One small mistake and you will get destroyed. This makes Zombie Night Terror rely a lot on trial and error. In most levels you will probably fail on your first couple of attempts. You learn from your mistakes though and approach the level better on your next attempt. The game is quite challenging since you aren't going to breeze through a lot of levels.

One of the game's greatest strengths are the graphics and overall theme. While the game uses pixel graphics, the graphics are great. The game's theme is also well done since it feels like a classic zombie movie.

At this point I have played the game for around two hours and I would say that I am just short of finishing about a fourth of the game. If the game gets more difficult like I am expecting I am guessing that the game will take around 10+ hours to complete.

If you love Lemmings style games or find the idea behind the game to be interesting I would highly recommend Zombie Night Terror as long as you're willing to be challenged. 

For my full review check out [url=http://www.geekyhobbies.com/zombie-night-terror-indie-game-review/] Geeky Hobbies [/url].

24442093.review: Zombie Night Terror (ZNT) is a lemmings styled, pixel art zombie game. At it's heart ZNT is a puzzle game with strategy elements, the idea being to accomplish the level's main and bonus objectives (though you'll probably end up trying to infect everyone and lose as few zombies as possible, which is fun and challenging). The level designs are varied and interesting, giving the player different ways to complete them, and the artwork and music are spot on. For the price this game is definitely worth it.

24441869.review:
断断续续已经全成就解锁就剩下最后一大关了，希望在24小时内能够通关

(不辱使命，在二十三小时半的时间内完成了这款游戏全成就)

这款游戏最开始的宣传动画吸引到了我：像素风格，不错的音乐配上脏逼和血。简简单单的红与黑将游戏环境分为描述的恰到好处

别小看这个游戏是像素风格，单游戏的路人造型很多...什么？你说路人本来就该有不一样的造型？那我脏逼们也弄多一点造型出来，别看我们长得一样，但！是！你看这个是有弓着背走的那个是驼着背走的，还有劈一字叉大步往前跨[spoiler] 不怕扯着蛋[/spoiler]的！你就说说，造型多不多！

这款像素风格的游戏流畅度很高，目前没有任何卡顿现象。配合上游戏的背景音乐下思考，每一次通关都是一种享受。而且在游戏中的小彩蛋也很多，两个警察深入黑帮窝点发生械斗。双方距离不到十米拔抢对射，二十几秒都没一个人倒下。脏逼们看不下去了，抓住一个机会就是冲钅...被团灭。你爸爸！说好的对射怎么都打脏逼了，城市套路深，我要回农村！

游戏难度在第四关...还是第几关来着会突然提升，需要玩家们反复的思试过关的方法，并且尝试着去通关。小tip：脏逼们虽然落点太高会被摔死，但是空中可以引爆感染敌人哦~。恩，当你们玩到有地铁那关就知道我说的什么了

每一关都有不同的要求，打法也各不相同，要求杀掉所有幸存者的，要求杀掉所有带枪的，杀到一定数量就可以过关的...当然也不全是杀杀杀，不然这个游戏多没意思啊！第一大关倒数第二关就是和敌人要逃往小车，这时候脏逼们得到了冲刺的BUFF，于是我们就要竞速！然后杀掉他们！

而且这个游戏关底还有BOSS！哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈，我最喜欢的就是首领战了！战个痛！

下面再来说说缺点

游戏毕竟是刚出来，有一部分小小的BUG：主要集中在第一大关倒数一二关，脏逼们在冲刺的时候遇到系统认为强制砸门的时候可能会选择掉头，而不是砸门（可以砸坏的门有两种：一是脏逼走到门直接开砸，二是玩家选择是否砸门）。我分析是因为脏逼在冲刺即将结束的时候有一个滑步刚好撞到了门上，于是系统不判定为脏逼砸门...在第四幕的时候,BUG出现得特别频繁：狙击手容易被卡墙角打不中僵尸啦，机械兄贵因为左右都有僵尸反而站着不动被一只巨型僵尸锤死啊，终极大BOSS眼球BUG掉不下来等等等等。虽说大不了重来一次，但是还是很影响游戏体验

我想这些BUG应该很快会得到修复...吧？

还有就是目前游戏关卡感觉有点短，两小时就把第一大关打通关了。目前看上去只有四大关，要是没有全成就收集癖，只想体验通关喜悦以及享受剧情的人来说，真的有点短。

总的来说这款游戏很不错的，喜欢动脑子不断尝试的抖M玩家可以理智+1，更何况最近打折哟~

嗷最后，求中文啊！！！！！！！！！！老子要看剧情还要百度翻译真是要死了！

————————————写在最后————————————
我思考了一晚上，觉得这么好的游戏销量低的原因一定是买了这个游戏的人，都没有耐心通关。

如果没有通关，那么他们也许不愿意向别人推荐。

我并不是说希望游戏难度降低，或许...有即时存档（当前难度为困难，有即时存档的为简单）大家愿意通关的热情会高很多？这样，好游戏就不会埋没了。毕竟当今，愿意花时间坐下来心平气和的好好享受一款游戏的人，已经不多了

24435122.review:
It's like assembling a 200-piece zombie jigsaw puzzle, where every piece must be placed in rythm to the second hand of a nearby clock, and if you mess up even once you must restart the entire puzzle.

This game is interesting, but unbelieveably hard. Time moves too fast for you to manage half of these puzzles, the GUI dissapears sometimes, the zombies sometimes get stuck floating in midair forever, and the lack of a quicksave means that it's incredibly frustrating to have to redo an entire level without a single checkpoint (I don't count the tutorial parts to each level as a checkpoint, they're more just a briefing), just because you missed a single necessary move at the end. 


For example there's an excruciatingly unfair part in the second chapter where you have to jump a wall-climbing zombie across a massive gap, so they can squeeze into an air duct. If you miss this shot, you're basically screwed and have to redo the entire level. The only reason I managed to pass this level was because the human AI messed up and walked right into the horde of zombies waiting outside, jamming the door open, and letting my meatshields through before the armed cops finished their "oh my gosh" animation.

Either way, it's fun if you like puzzle games. I've got a middling opinion about it. I thought it would have more zombies and automation to it, but the game is relentless with swarms of ranged enemies who can drop an entire horde in a millisecond, as well as dead ends which force you to restart, and a miserably low tolerance for error. There's even plenty of parts where the game won't even give you time to get your bearings, with enemies attacking you IMMEDIATELY. Naturally this game is 40% trial and error.

6/10, would recomend on sale to perfectionists and puzzle fans.

Ok so I loooove games like this and honestly the game itself isn't bad but it does have a few issues, for the most part the game is of reasonable length, at about 7 hours in Im basically 3/4 of the way through so the game is roughly 8-10 hours depending how good you are at puzzles because make no mistake, this -is- a puzzle game albeit with more action and zombies. 

One great thing about the game is the art and atmosphere, It feels like an old style horror movie, the jokes are hit n miss but I think thats kinda the point, the game does not take itself seriously which is good, gives the game some charm in the blood-soaked brain eating apocalypse setting.

My issues though for the most part can be adressed for the most part, AI can do dumb things, a later level requires you to basically escort some humans and a science pair who must not die.. but because the AI is being attacked by other enemies, they can glitch and refuse to move, thus basically failing the mission, other times AI fire -way- too fast, it becomes impossible to fight them as even a horde of 30 zombies can't beat 1 soldier as his gun fires too quick and basically forces them all into a kill-line and the game has NO checkpoints, you screw up one little thing? you restart the map, no exceptions. 

More issues with level-design sadly, some levels try gimicks.. BAD gimicks, with as little spoilers as possible.. destructable terrain with limited zombie-bombs = bad   

a map in pure darkness with non-renewable light-zombies who don't even provide much light = bad (game has no gamma btw, no cheating for us)

A map offering 'choice' when really theres only one option = bad 
 
and a mission that requires something Circumstantial that I never used it before and after the mission and it feels like it was put there just to screw with people on a mission that's already slow and pretty dull. (use the scream with a tank.. you'll understand what I mean when you get there)

Now -overall- the game is fun, well made and yeah, its got bugs but alot fewer than i'd expect BUT be warned, some people have been getting black-screen or unable to even start.

I can -JUST- barely recommend the game, for what it is, its alot of fun and £10  isn't too bad a price honestly, it feels reasonable for the offering here.

24430557.review:
Zombie Night Terror can be summarized in two game titles: Lemmings and Left 4 Dead. And yet it manages to be its own thing.

For once, the aim is not to prevent the apocalypse but to make sure it happens. In order to do so, the player guides a horde of zombies that walk in a straight line (Lemmings) by giving them specialized Zombie powers (Left 4 Dead). 
Lemmings had a very cool concept and it was a gaming landmark, but it did not exactly expand into a fruitful genre. The reason why is that the core gameplay loop ended up being quite repetitive after a while, because on one hand only a select few Lemmings acquired a power that allowed them to survive, and on the other hand the higher difficulty levels ended up being a tedious chore of bridge building. 

Interestingly, Zombie Night Terror actually manages to avoid the pitfalls of Lemmings with some smart modifications to the formula. First, it is possible to replenish “Zombie power” and thus the starting number of possible transformations is not as restrictive as it was in Lemmings. Second, Zombie Night Terror outshines Lemmings in its horde management. For instance, stairs are already built (it is not Zombie Minecraft!) and the player can simply choose in which direction to take them. But the real improvement comes from a brilliant concept: the classical “blocker” that forces the horde to move in a specific direction can be given additional powers that will translate to the Zombies that the “blocker” (or Overlord here) manages. In other words: the Overlord can make the whole Zombie army jump to the next building, not only a few chosen Zombies. A lot of depth is gained with that addition, allowing the player to keep a good horde flow while moving around in a level. 

However, that flow can sometimes be hindered by the high difficulty and the “puzzle” aspect of the game that requires the player to figure out what to do to reach some areas or survive some encounters. Sometimes a bit hard to figure out (often through trial and error - maybe the possibility to save the game would have alleviated that aspect). Difficult yet nothing impossible, so succeeding is very gratifying. Just that some (thankfully rare) levels have a timer and can be frustrating. So it’s really good to be able to pause the game to give orders. On top of that, understanding the different powers very well is required to progress through the game, for most levels it is not possible to just wing it on the first try. Additionally, the game mechanics allow for some really interesting tricks that are hinted at in the achievements or optional challenges.

Another difference with Lemmings is that some levels are more focused on micro-managing one or a few Zombies, making use of the “temporary powers” to navigate the levels as if it was a turn-based platformer, and take the upper hand in gunfights. Those pesky humans dare oppose the Zombie apocalypse with dangerous guns and rifles! These tactical levels are also very difficult and remind me a lot of how I felt when playing the commando missions in Command & Conquer and Red Alert. Very action-packed and yet very tactical. And then the next level goes back to a nice massive bloodbath so that the game is not repetitive.

The graphics are really cute, a nice horror movie feel with black & white colors but for the bloody red. The animations make the pixel-art work really well. Add to that really funny lines of dialog, whether during cutscenes or random chatter in the levels, and you have a very cool package.

In conclusion, Zombie Night Terror expands nicely on the concept of Lemmings, with great concepts and good execution. And much more action and blood. It has everything in the right places, if you are not afraid of facing some tough levels that require good timing and understanding of the levels and powers. Very likely one of those rare indie titles that come to fame…

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=728315888

24426426.review:
■初見プレイでの感想
8Bitテイストのゾンビゲーは多いのではあるが、ゾンビを操作して人間を襲ってゾンビにしていくゲームというのはなかなかに斬新。

ただし、ゾンビの脳はすでに腐っているので非常にざっくりで簡単な命令しかだせない（そこがミソなんですが･･･）
どれくらいざっくりかというと

・そこのドアを壊して
・そこの階段上って（or上らないで）
・とりあえず突然変異して
・爆発して壁壊してくれ

くらいの命令しか与えられない。
その先に崖があろうが飛び込み自殺するし、人間がバリケードでキルポイント作っていようが突っ込んでいく。

マップも決められた目標を到達するのですが、配置と使える変異は決まっており、どのようなルートでゾンビを送り込んでいくか考えるゲーム。
つまるところ、ストラテジーで分類されているが、これは間違いなくアクションパズルゲーム。
しかも、ゾンビが勝手に死なないように、その行動をパズル的思考で決めていくのは、言ってしまえば遥か昔に世界的ヒットとなったレミングスそのものと言える。

シンプルなゲームですが、思考の濃さと奥深さ。
なによりゾンビモノの基本である「ゾンビに大群にのまれた人間が次々とゾンビとなる爽快さ」はなによりGoodな点だと思います
（ゾンビにしちゃえば、新しいリソースとして使えるというシステムもゲーム性を高めています）

■日本語
残念ながら日本語化されていませんが、英語のままでもなんとなくわかるので、日本語で購入を悩んでいるのであれば、気にせず購入できるのではないかと思います。

24425266.review:
[b] Target Audience: [/b] [I] Lemmings Fans or Strategy gamers who want a zombie twist[/i]

[b] Summary: [/b]  
Zombie Night Terror surprised me. I thought I'd get another strategy game with a zombie twist, and to an extent, I did. But what I didn't expect was the level of game design here. This game not only feels well thought out from all sides of its mechanics, but they all combine together to make a nice little Lemmings-inspired game that works on multiple levels. The presentation of the story and visual elements flow naturally: you feel like the narrative that plays out could “realistically” work, and fits the story into the gameplay rather seamlessly. Great level variety that forces the player to think about using the new mechanics he recently learned helps to keep the gameplay fresh throughout the experience. In fact, a lot of the complaints I have about the game are things that the player can easily get used to with a little bit of experience with the mechanics. Granted, I still want keyboard labels on the toolbar, but hey, I'm a stickler for things that make things easier for the player. In the end, Zombie Night Terror really reminded me of Lemmings in several ways, which is surprising....because I really didn't necessarily like Lemmings all that much. But maybe I've grown as a gamer and what not, because Zombie Night Terror did the job of entertaining me and allowed me to flex my brain once or twice while doing it. 


[b]Video Review: [/b]  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OfteO0ZzxCs

[u] Lists: [/u]
[b]Positives:[/b]
[list]
[*] One of the biggest praise I have for a game: All the design elements that are present here work together well, and nothing feels unnecessary mechanic wise. Everything is there for a reason, and for more then just a “one-off” level. Great Game Design at its core here.
[*] Great level variety that forces you to use your newly obtained skill set in creative ways. Not just about grabbing as many zombies as you can, as levels like trying to survive a long and narrow train tunnel really keep things fresh.
[*] Good simplicity of gameplay mechanics and design here, but really well thought out in terms of costs/options. Simple but effective.
[*] Pause/speed options done well here. Allows for some flexibility but still allows players to actually be efficient at regular speed. 
[*] Good difficulty spot. Not too challenging, but challenging enough to force the player to think. Sweet spot in terms of difficulty pace too. 
[*] Really nice presentation story wise. Things flow easily from gameplay to the story telling, everything feels natural while not really taking you out of the moment. Haven't really seen a strategy game do it like ZNT in a long while.  
[*] The black and white style really works here, as it has the old filmy look down. Little touches like the sounds of a film reel when pausing/fast forwarding the game really complements things.
[*] Understands the different zombie tropes rather well. Good humor mixed in with nice references from some of the more popular zombie media out there. Although the drug naming is a little bit on the nose. 
[*] No performance problems seen. Despite the fact that FRAPS indicated that it had a 1000 FPS at time (lol what), it runs smoothly at high FPS with nothing really stopping it. 
[/list]

[b]Negatives:[/b]
[list]
[*] Implementation of the Arc jump and throw seems to be a little off, as it does not take into account walls/ceilings properly. Shows that you'll make the jump, and low and behold you hit a ceiling and now you're falling to your death.
[*] While the music is appropriate to the game, its lack of variety does really stand out over time. It wants a dark tone and a haunting melody: and there's multiple ways musically to do that. Instead, you get variations of pretty much the same music. 
[*] This is a feature request, but a needed one: keyboard labels on the toolbar. This should be a standard in strategy games, especially on the PC platform. Just makes things that much easier.
[*] Do wish the zombies kept a little more personality of the people who they converted. 
[/list]

The story progression is very castle crashers-esque, in the sense that you chase around this slippery guy (the Chemist) throughout various worlds, so by the time you reach him you're just itching for a chance to kick his ass.
